intro: Asarca alpina, commonly known as the alpine ginger, is a perennial herb native to the mountainous regions of Europe and Asia. It belongs to the family Zingiberaceae, which includes true gingers, and is characterized by its aromatic, rhizomatous root system. The plant produces clusters of small, white or pale yellow flowers that bloom in late summer. Its leaves are narrow, lance-shaped, and often have a distinctive, spicy scent. Asarca alpina thrives in cool, moist environments and is often found in alpine meadows and rocky habitats.
